title.native: 僕のヒーローアカデミア４

description:
The villain world teeters on the brink of war now that All For One is out of the picture. Shigaraki of the League of Villains squares off with Overhaul of the yakuza, vying for total control of the shadows. Meanwhile, Deku gets tangled in another dangerous internship as he struggles to keep pace with his upperclassman—Mirio.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: มายฮีโร่ อคาเดเมีย ภาค 4

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

node.description:
Horikoshi first attracted attention in the second half of 2006 when he entered Shueisha's 72nd Tezuka Award for Newcomers with his one shot _Nukegara_ and made it to the final six, where he received an Honorable Mention. Various short stories in Shueisha's Akamaru Jump followed over the years until he published his one-shot _Oumagadoki Doubutsuen_ in issue #2/2010 of Weekly Shounen Jump.

He is a former assistant of [Yasuki Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/97521/Yasuki-Tanaka).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/horikoshiko)

__[Website](https://www.sayuri-official.com/)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1wLdD1RVGp_rLH1NRJnD0A)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taltalasuka)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sayuri149cm/)__

Sanketsu Shoujo Sayuri (lit. "Suffocating girl Sayuri") was a Japanese singer, musician and songwriter, signed under Ariola Japan.
Sayuri labeled herself as a 2.5D-parallel singer/songwriter, meaning she expressed herself through the internet in the 2D world and through live performances in the 3D world. 
For her 2D appearance she created various characters, mainly used in her music videos. While they all bear the name of Sayuri, each character's name differentiates itself by a different mix of Hiragana and Katakana (さゆり, サユリ, サゆり).

Sayuri made her major debut with the single "[Mikazuki](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=65BAeDpwzGY)", which was used as the ending theme to the Fuji TV anime "[Ranpo Kitan: Game of Laplace](https://anilist.co/anime/21189/Ranpo-Kitan-Game-of-Laplace/)".  Her first full-length album “Mikazuki no Kokai”, released May 17, 2017, debuted at #1 on Oricon’s daily album chart.

Sayuri announced her marriage to the vocalist and composer Ama Arashi (from the music group Misekai) on March 18th, 2024.

On September 27, 2024, her husband posted [an announcement](https://x.com/taltalasuka/status/1839500307094450552) on her X/Twitter account that she had passed away on September 20, 2024 at the age of 28.

name.native: ブルー・エンカウント

node.description:
__[Website](https://blueencount.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BLUEN_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/blueencount_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/blueencountSMEJ)__

__Formed:__ 2004
__Genres:__ Rock (Mixture Rock, Indie Rock), Emo

__Introduction:__
Blue Encount (stylized as BLUE ENCOUNT), alternatively known under the abbreviation BLUEN is a Japanese four-piece rock band under record label Ki/oon Records (2014-), who have previously been under record label 美音 (Mio) (2013-2014)

__Biography:__
In 2003, Shunichi, Yuuya and Yoshihide met at a vocational school in the Kumamoto Prefecture, where they would later in 2004 form the band Blue Encount. The band's name derives from a jinx that says bands with a color in their name sells, as well as a movie that the vocalist Shunichi saw at a rental shop titled "Blue Encounter".

In 2006, at the TEENS' MUSIC FESTIVAL, which was sponsored by the Yamaha Music Promotion Association and Nippon Broadcasting, they participated in the Kyuushuu qualifying round as the Kumamoto Prefecture representative, but they did not advance to the national competition. The bassist at the time withdrew from the band to enter university, and after graduating from a certain college of technology Yuuya and Yoshihide came to Tokyo and began studying at the Tokyo School of Music College in Shibuya. Yuuta, a senior at a vocational school participated as a support member at the time.

In 2008, the band participated in Yamaha's "The 2nd Music Revolution JAPAN FINAL" as a representative of Tokyo FINAL. This is also when Yuuta officially decided to join the band.

In 2010, the band released their first mini album titled "The Beginning of the Beginning". The response on the album were not as expected, and the members of the band instead called it "The Dark Ages". After that, they went on a split tour with the bands ircle and SUPER BEAVER, and said that occasional advice from both of the bands was a large help to escape the "dark age" as they called it.

On April 11, 2012, the 2nd mini album "HALO EFFECT" was released. The title song "HALO" has helped increase the number of YouTube views, and the number of live shows started piling in for them as a band.

On November, 2013, they released a split album titled "BONEDS" with the bands [MY FIRST STORY](https://anilist.co/staff/127675/My-First-Story), AIR SWELL and [SWANKY DANK](https://anilist.co/staff/132868/SWANKY-DANK).

On September 10, 2014, they made a major debut under Ki/oon Music with their EP titled "TIMELESS ROOKIE", this is also when they left their previous record label titled 美音 (Mio).

On October 9, 2016, the band made had their first one-man live show held at the Nippon Budokan. The tickets sold out the same day and had 11.000 people pending for the show. In addition, during this live performance, they directy spoke with the producer of the Japanese television drama "THE LaST COP/ラストコップ", and was then scheduled to perform the theme song for the show. The drama first broadcasted on the October 29, which is when they made their first appearance in a serial TV drama as a unit.

__Members:__
- [Shunichi Tanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/148599/Shunichi-Tanabe) (田邊駿一) - vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition (2004-)
- Yuuya Eguchi (江口雄也) - guitarist (2004-)
- Yuuta Tsujimura (辻村勇太) - bassist (2006-2008, as a support member) (2008-, as an official member)
- Yoshihide Takamura (高村佳秀) - drummer (2004-)

(Source: [Wikipedia (BLUE ENCOUNT)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/BLUE_ENCOUNT), edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ccarrollbeard) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/colleen.clinkenbeardvoiceactress)

An American voice actress and theatre actress, working mainly in the commercial and dubbing industries. She has also served as ADR director, line producer, and script writer for several anime titles for Funimation.

She gave birth to her first son, Rhodes Vandelo Carroll, on September 4, 2014.
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Aspired to work in the industry after having seen [Laputa: Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/).
__Masahiro Mukai__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ushimou730) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/馬越嘉彦)

A highly prolific and respected character designer.

Originating from Monsieur Onion, where he spent his in-betweening days studying under [Hirotoshi Takaya](https://anilist.co/staff/117473/) and [Junichi Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/140660/). In 1991, he moved to Studio Cockpit with [Hisashi Kagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120432/) and [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/). A few years later he debuted as a character designer on [Grappler Baki](https://anilist.co/anime/1859/) in 1994.

He is said to be a very fast and efficient worker, and according to himself, he much rather participates in TV productions than theatrical ones. Close friends with [Hiroshi Nagahama](https://anilist.co/staff/99346/) whom he often works with. They first worked together on [Juubei-chan 2](https://anilist.co/anime/636/), for which Umakoshi provided the designs for and served as the chief animation director on all 13 episodes. The following year, the duo teamed up again for [Mushishi](https://anilist.co/anime/457/), which's production quality was unusually high for a TV production. Umakoshi designed the characters and worked as the chief animation director on all 26 episodes of the series and hit a burn-out. After this he took a step back on major roles for a few years. Both him and Nagahama reprised their roles on Mushishi's revival in 2014.

In 2016, Umakoshi was appointed as the character designer on [My Hero Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21459/), and has since been highly involved with the series' production as both an animation director and animator.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mocchi_0422)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dhica_tw)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hitoyaaaan)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hitoyaaaan)

**[SOUND BOX Profile (JP)](http://www.sound-box.jp/information/shizuo_k.html)** | **[SOUND BOX Profile (EN)](http://www.sound-box.jp/english/information/shizuo_k.html)**

Shizuo Kurahashi is a Japanese sound effects editor. He worked as an editor at the Nikkatsu filming studio. After that he started his sound career in ToyoOnkyo. 

He established his own company SOUND BOX in 1988. Since 1983, when the dolby stereo system got popular in Japan - he has been creating filmsounds. He has edited and arranged sounds for over 1000 works.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bell_yot)__

__Andou Youta__ is a Japanese CG director.

Kozue Kananiwa graduated from the HOSEI University of Tokyo, Faculty of Letters, Department of Japan Literature. Her first work as a producer was for [Oh! My Goddess](https://anilist.co/anime/50/Aa-Megamisama-TV/) in 2005.

Since, she participated in the production many renown series such as [Mahou Shoujo Madoka☆Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Mahou-Shoujo-MadokaMagica/) in 2011, [Steins;Gate](https://anilist.co/anime/9253/SteinsGate) the same year, or more recently [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/Horimiya/).

Now, she is the General Manager of  both U-NEXT Anime & Book Division and of the Production Department.

(Source : Bangumi 番組計画RC3)
**Akito Takahashi** is a publicity producer working for Toho.
__Kazutaka Yamanaka__ is a Japanese producer.
